intro: Genista aequinoctialis, commonly known as the autumn broom, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as coastal areas and limestone soils. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Genista aequinoctialis is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in marginal environments.
